item.title: What changes can tourism bring to rural areas? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description A recent report from a leading online travel agency reveals a significant surge in orders for rural tourism in China during the first three quarters of 2023, surpassing levels recorded in the pre-pandemic year of 2019. We’ll discuss the prospect of rural tourism. On the show: Laiming, Niu Honglin & Brandon Yates Transcript

item.title: International performers shine on stages in China | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description 2023 has been a total blast for the arts scene in China! We’re talking about global performances landing right on our doorstep, and our homegrown talents captivating audiences on world stage. In what ways have these cultural exchanges become instrumental in strengthening the bonds between China and other countries? / Round Table’s Happy Place (21:40)! On the show: Heyang, Xingyu & Josh Cotterill Transcript

item.title: Young people redefining retirement dreams | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description We’ll take a deep dive into the topic of retirement planning. China has got a one-year-old private pension initiative in the mix. We discuss how the younger crowd is turning the tables on retirement expectations. On the show: Heyang, Xingyu & Josh Cotterill Transcript

item.title: 'The Queen of News' - The rise, rewards, and risks of occupational drama | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description We step into the fast-paced universe of media professionals, where every headline is a battle, and every broadcast could hold the key to success. Hong Kong TVB’s latest sensation ‘The Queen of News’ has got many in the audience hooked! What makes occupational drama series so irresistible? On the show: Heyang, Li Yi & Josh Cotterill Transcript

item.title: China is the world's largest food importer! | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Did you know that China is not only the ultimate foodie haven but also snagged the title of the world’s BIGGEST food importer? You won’t believe the numbers or flavors hitting Chinese dinner tables! It’s not just about a nice meal; it’s practically a world tour on a plate! So get ready to salivate. We are cooking up a storm and serving it right into your ears! On the show: Heyang, Li Yi & Josh Cotterill

item.title: Are American CEOs overpaid? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description American CEOs are often paid hundreds of times more than their company employees. Is that a problem? / Young Chinese explore uninhabited islands (21:35). On the show: Heyang, Xingyu & Brandon Yates Transcript

item.title: Underwear market in China now bigger than ever | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description The bra and underwear market in China has grown bigger than ever, with domestic brands quickly taking over the intimate wardrobes of a new generation of Chinese women. We discuss the recipe to success of these companies. On the show: Heyang, Xingyu & Brandon Yates Transcript

item.title: Are restaurant dances a hit or a miss? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Ever been to a restaurant where the waitstaffs don’t just serve up delicious dishes but might also break into spontaneous dance moves? We dive into the debate of: Are these restaurant dances a cringe-fest or entertainment gold? / Dragon mascots got rizz. (21:44) On the show: Heyang, Yushun & Gao Junya Transcript

item.title: A reality check on China's express delivery industry | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description A whopping 120 billion parcels crisscrossing the nation annually! We go beyond the speedy deliveries to look at the logistics behind these province-and-border-hopping parcels, and explore how the industry is stepping up its game on the green front. On the show: Heyang, Yushun & Gao Junya Transcript

item.title: What does popularity of the Vietnamese version of a Chinese reality show imply? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Chinese reality shows are getting excellent ratings in Vietnam, reaching the Vietnamese audience in different forms and formats. What does the success of a few shows say about the relationship between our two peoples? / Motivational Monday (19:15)! On the show: Laiming, Niu Honglin & Li Yi Transcript

item.title: 2023 in review through the echoes of buzzwords | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description The buzzwords popping up everywhere on social media and in our everyday discourse can say a lot about our lives in the past year. Let’s review 2023 through the unique lens of buzzwords. On the show: Laiming, Niu Honglin & Li Yi Transcript

item.title: Bookstores diversify as cultural spaces | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description You must be familiar with brick-and-mortar bookstores having a tough time in the era of online shopping. Well, bookshops are now trying something different to stay alive and relevant. Are we witnessing a revolution in retail, or is there something deeper at play? / Round Table’s Happy Place (18:56)! On the show: Heyang, Yushun & Josh Cotterill Transcript

item.title: Teaching digital literacy to digital natives | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s spotlight on RoundTable unveils the exciting quest for learning in a digital world. Join us as we explore the task of teaching digital natives, crack the code of cyber security in education, and navigate the vast digital frontier together. On the show: Heyang, Yushun & Josh Cotterill Transcript

item.title: Should we master first-aid skills? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description The percentage of Chinese people who have mastered first-aid skills stands at a dangerously low rate. Both the central government and regional authorities have taken actions to improve the situation, but satisfactory results are yet to be seen. What more needs to be done? / Will gossip against a third-party foster deeper friendship between two people (20:16)? On the show: Laiming, Niu Honglin & Brandon Yates Transcript

item.title: Opportunities and challenges faced by cities amidst social media frenzy | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description It seems Chinese cities are taking turns grabbing public attention over the internet. Beginning with the city of Zibo in east China’s Shandong Province, more and more cities have become internet sensations as people share tips and reflections about how best to enjoy a nice city tour. Today on Round Table, we discuss what makes a city sensational. On the show: Laiming, Niu Honglin & Brandon Yates Transcript

item.title: What makes soundtracks and music scores tug at our heartstrings? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description When music in movies and TV drama series is played exceptionally well, it has the ability to latch onto our nostalgic heartstrings. We go down our playlists of timeless favorites and try to answer this question: do recent music scores and soundtracks hold up to the same standard as their predecessors? On the show: Heyang, Xingyu & Josh Cotterill Transcript

item.title: Why are celebs leaving the livestream selling scene? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Today, we’re spotlighting a captivating new trend in ecommerce – celebrities bidding adieu to the livestream selling scene. Are they exiting in grace or being booted out? / A dad gives a speech at a school meeting beaming with pride at his son, despite his son’s mediocre grades. Why has the video gone viral (19:12)? On the show: Heyang, Xingyu & Josh Cotterill Transcript

item.title: The rise of morning workouts among Chinese youth | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Rise and shine, or hit snooze and recline? We dive into the fascinating rise of morning workouts among China’s youth - unpacking the why, the how, and whether it’s worth it to trade sunrise stretches for a few extra winks. / Keeping warm in wintertime (22:37) On the show: Heyang, Li Yi & Ding Heng Transcript

item.title: Crafting your ideal TV experience in the streaming era | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Traditional cable TV has been witnessing a steady decline in subscribers for over a decade, as consumers increasingly shift towards streaming services. In our exploration of television viewing services, we delve into the areas that could welcome some improvements. Can a new industry standard address all these concerns? On the show: Heyang, Li Yi & Ding Heng Transcript

item.title: China has banned the use of so-called 'fresh lamps' | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description China’s market regulator has recently put a stop to the use of the so-called “fresh lamps” in grocery stores and supermarkets which butchers have been using to cast their products in favorable lighting. We will discuss this new regulation to see whether it is achieving its intended results. / Motivational Monday (19:12)! On the show: Laiming, Niu Honglin & Brandon Yates Transcript

item.title: China's skiing frenzy continues with the arrival of a new snow season | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Skiing participation already was on the rise before the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing. Now with COVID-19 out of the way, businesses expect and are experiencing strong growth. And amidst all this skiing frenzy, we’ve spotted some new trends that we hope to share with you. On the show: Laiming, Niu Honglin & Brandon Yates Transcript

item.title: Might there just be such a thing as a free lunch? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Hungry minds out there, listen up! Have you ever wished for a free lunch? Well, hold on to your chopsticks because we’re about to dish out the details on a trend called “eat and run meals. “/ Round Table’s Happy Place (17:23)! On the show: Heyang, Li Yi & Josh Cotterill Transcript

item.title: Anticipating more climate actions at COP28 | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description We are in the thick of the 28th UN Climate Change Conference, COP28, already in full swing in Dubai. World leaders have converged in the UAE, fueled by a collective mission to tackle climate change head-on. We’ll explore what ambitious climate actions might be on the horizon, with expert opinions from Derek Elsworth, Professor of Energy and Geo-Environmental Engineering at Pennsylvania State University, adding depth and clarity to the discussion.

item.title: Decoding the date: What lies behind 'near-expired foods?' | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description We take behind-the-scenes look at the industry of close-to-expire food! Are near-expired foods a budget-friendly buffet for foodies or a scheme that businesses use to deal with the ticking expiry clock. From a seller’s hustle to your kitchen – we’re talking about the money, the ethics, and everything in between. / Clearing the air: debunking respiratory myths for winter warriors (19:52). On the show: Niu Honglin, Xingyu & Josh Cotterill

item.title: China holds first supply chain expo | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description We step into the heartbeat of global commerce as the first China International Supply Chain Expo is underway here in Beijing. How are global supply chains affecting our daily lives? What are some highlights that one would not want to miss? On the show: Niu Honglin, Xingyu & Li Yunqi Transcript

item.title: Do you talk more like a zoomer or a boomer at work? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description ‘Slay,’ ‘I’m dead’ and ‘yass queen’ are just a few phrases that Gen Z have snuck into the American workplace. But for older colleagues not keeping up with the latest trends, those phrases might just fly over their heads. Or worse yet, their meanings might be misinterpreted. We take a look at the generational differences in how we talk at work! On the show: Heyang, Yushun & Josh Cotterill

item.title: Why are short drama videos gaining global appeal? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Get ready for a wild ride into the world of short drama videos, that’s unabashedly tacky, clichéd, and yet, undeniably beloved. From forbidden alphas to reborn wives, these short video series may seem over the top, but with skyrocketing viewing numbers, it’s clear that the world secretly loves drama. Buckle up, drama lovers – it’s about to get so bad, it’s good! On the show: Heyang, Yushun & Josh Cotterill

item.title: Why do employees hate hot-desking? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description In 2023, hot-desking means sharing on-site workspaces between employees who work remotely most of the time but occasionally need to come to the office. Why do a third of American employees in a survey hate it? / Should I sit in the front row of the lecture hall (21:06)? On the show: Heyang, Niu Honglin & Yushun Transcript

item.title: Latest weight-loss drug hardly the fix for obesity | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Ozempic and a popular new class of medications like it are transforming the medical approach to obesity, challenging traditional perspectives on weight and its treatment. However, this drug, initially designed for diabetes management, is facing a global shortage due to its popularity among weight-loss enthusiasts. Using drugs to stop cravings - isn’t that a bad thing? Are there any side effects that we should be aware of? On the show: Heyang, Niu Honglin & Yushun

item.title: Living legacies of intangible cultural heritage | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description ‘Intangible Cultural Heritage’ represents the essence of a community’s identity. In a fast changing world, it’s important to ensure the preservation and protection of these invaluable cultural assets. In China, many localities are trying out an approach by blending cultural heritage with tourism. How can we strike a harmonious balance between sharing these treasures with the world and safeguarding them for generations to come? On the show: Heyang, Li Yi and Dr.

item.title: Can genetic testing predict talent? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Can genetic testing predict a child’s talents? Is it a crystal ball into their future abilities, or should we approach it with caution? / Round Table’s Happy Place (23:33)! On the show: Heyang, Ding Heng & Josh Cotterill Transcript

item.title: Are seniors the new growth catalyst for e-commerce? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description The increasing presence of senior consumers in the online world could reshape the ecommerce marketplace. How can we optimize the online shopping experience for the elderly to ensure that they can navigate it with ease? On the show: Heyang, Ding Heng & Josh Cotterill Transcript

item.title: Are baked goods becoming overpriced? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description As some bakeries push the boundaries of creativity, their prices are also becoming more and more jaw-dropping. item.title: Driving forces for maternal and infant industry upgrade | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description In a world where raising a child has transformed from a shared responsibility to a meticulous, sometimes high-tech endeavor, the maternal and infant industry stands as a testament to this paradigm shift. From the quest for the perfect diaper to the intricacies of high-end baby formula, join us as we decode the driving forces behind this parenting revolution. On the show: Niu Honglin, Li Yi & Josh Cotterill

item.title: Research publications not mandatory for PhDs in a few Chinese universities | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description A few Chinese universities recently announced that research publications are no longer mandatory for their PhD students. item.title: Spending power of men | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description In retail analysis in China, there’s a somewhat tongue-in-cheek observation: Men are often consigned to the bottom of the consumption hierarchy, falling even behind pet dogs and cats. But, maybe we’ve gotten it wrong all those years! On the show: Heyang, Li Yi & Josh Cotterill Transcript

item.title: What can we do to safeguard valuable heritage tucked away in narrow historic streets? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description As our cities rapidly urbanize, many people lament the loss of landmarks and historic streets that they grew up with. Should we wipe out every old building and every ancient street to make room for bigger, taller and more efficient high-rises? We discuss the approaches to sooth our nostalgia and preserve our culture. / Have you ever thought about a personality test for companies and businesses (21:02)? item.title: What makes outdoor sports so popular? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Outdoor sports activities are picking up in popularity. What has been driving the increasing enthusiasm in the great outdoors and who are these people climbing mountains and hugging trees? What opportunities does this trend present to relevant industries? On the show: Laiming, Niu Honglin & Yushun Transcript

item.title: Community pharmacies become local health hubs | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description From handling minor illnesses to long-term conditions, we’ve got your back. Learn why community pharmacies are the neighborhood champions for health advice and support! / Motivational Monday(19:46)! On the show: Heyang, Li Yi & Yushun Transcript

item.title: Do pop-up stores make your business pop? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description We explore the fascinating world of pop-up retail, or flash retailing. In my eyes, as a slightly less sympathetic observer, they’re like the wannabes of the retail scene, here one day and gone the next. Our discussion will go beyond the glossy facade of pop-up stores. On the show: Heyang, Li Yi & Yushun Transcript

item.title: Are music festivals losing their creative edge? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description We share with you what made us happy this week in RoundTable’s Happy Place! / Music festivals used to be incubators for creativity in music, culture and fashion. Despite explosive popularity in the post-covid era, music festivals are now being questioned: Have they plateaued? Are music festivals no longer the breeding grounds for new and groundbreaking ideas in music and fashion (16:18)? On the show: Heyang, Yushun & Josh Cotterill

item.title: Bring back 10-minute recess to schools | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description The ‘10-minute recess’ getting too quiet in elementary schools? The Internet is buzzing with criticism! Why are some students losing their playtime, and what does it mean for their well-being? On the show: Heyang, Yushun & Josh Cotterill Transcript

item.title: From shopping to experiencing: the resurgence of wet markets in China | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description As we plan our journeys to new cities, the search for authentic experiences becomes increasingly important. Some might follow the new style of city walk, while others seek help from the locals. However, some young Chinese travelers have figured out a third option: visiting the traditional wet markets. Today we’ll explore this fascinating travel trend. / ‘Shy Girl Workouts’ Trend on Tiktok (20:35). On the show: Niu Honglin, Fei Fei & Josh Cotterill

item.title: Young Chinese adults opt for evening classes after work | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description While blinking neon lights of Shanghai paint the city in dazzling glows, a different kind of radiance has captured the attention of many of its young residents. Night schools have become a sensation, attracting swarms of eager learners fresh out of their cubicles. Round table takes you to discover the allure of Shanghai’s nocturnal learning revolution. On the show: Niu Honglin, Fei Fei & Josh Cotterill Transcript

item.title: Cultural exchanges between China and the U.S. | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description We explore the remarkable cultural exchanges between China and the U.S., focusing on the unique experiences of artists and scholars who have been bridging these two nations. In a world where cultures intertwine, creativity knows no borders, and art becomes a universal language. We can all have faith in a better future. / Yushun’s one-day tour in NYU Shanghai (39:29). On the show: Niu Honglin, Xingyu, Allan Denis Naymark & Yushun

item.title: EU bans microplastics to combat plastic pollution | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description In a significant stride towards a cleaner future, the European Commission introduced a ban on microplastics. How significant is the microplastic problem? What is China doing to tackle plastic pollution? / What are the factors behind the yawning gap in personal energy levels (19:27)? On the show: Niu Honglin, Xingyu & Brandon Yates Transcript

item.title: Navigating the Sweet Dilemma - World Diabetes Day Special | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description As we observe World Diabetes Day, we delve into the complex landscape of diabetes in China and beyond. From skyrocketing cases to the influence of lifestyle, we dissect the sweet dilemma that millions face daily. Join us as we examine the multifaceted factors that contribute to the rise of diabetes, question how the world can collectively combat the silent epidemic of diabetes. On the show: Niu Honglin, Xingyu & Brandon Yates

item.title: Why young people crowd the lower levels in shopping malls | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description At the moment, the spotlight is cast on young consumers and their inclination to shop on underground levels, rather than immersing in the glamour and serenity of the upper decks. Why has it turn into a thing that deserves so much attention and discussion over the internet? / Motivational Monday(19:54)! On the show: Laiming, Niu Honglin & Li Yi Transcript

item.title: 10 years on: World Internet Conference Wuzhen Summit | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description The advent of the internet and the onslaught of AI technologies have introduced more complexities to our lives in the cyberspace. Today, we investigate the efforts of online community-building as a recent annual gathering of the internet industry sheds some light on business development in China and around the world. On the show: Laiming, Niu Honglin & Li Yi Transcript

item.title: A sneak peek into the future: interview with designer Alexander Brandt | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Heyang interviews visionary designer, Alexander Brandt, chief designer of the record-setting Shanghai Astronomy Museum, and the brilliant mind behind “AI’s Dreams”. They discuss the controversies of AI & tech, the future of immersive education, and how to stay creative in today’s fast-changing world. Transcript

item.title: WeWork doesn't work. Now what? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Office-sharing company, WeWork, once a venture capital darling valued at 47 billion USD, has filed for bankruptcy on November 6th. What went so wrong in this company that was once one of America’s most valuable start-ups? On the show: Heyang, Yushun & Josh Cotterill Transcript

item.title: Plus-size travelers on public transport | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description A video about a plus-size girl trying to squeeze herself into her seat in public transport sparked a wave of controversy. What infrastructure do we need in public places both in our physical world and in the cyberspace? / Some frequent travelers claim there are now less movie options when they fly with commercial airlines. Is that true (19:22)? On the show: Laiming, Li Yi & Josh Cotterill

item.title: China releases white paper on development of distant-water fisheries | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description A white paper sheds some light on the development of China’s distant water fishing industry. Why should the average listeners of Round Table care about what’s going on hundreds of thousands nautical miles off China’s coast? How does it affect our lives? On the show: Laiming, Li Yi & Josh Cotterill Transcript

item.title: RT special: Seeds of Change - Through urban gardening to a greener city | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Round Table’s Heyang continues her trip in Shanghai. This time, she visits a rooftop experimental farm at NYU Shanghai, in the middle of the bustling metropolis! She talks to professors about how creativity and cultivation intersect with urban farming, art, and the city development. Transcript

item.title: RT special: Shanghai Shines – CIIE Sparks Innovation and Connections | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Round Table’s Heyang is in Shanghai amid one of the most important events taking place in the city - the China International Import Expo (CIIE). Together with Professor Chen Yuxin, Dean of Business at NYU Shanghai, and Eric Zheng, President of the American Chamber of Commerce in Shanghai, she explores the impact created by the Expo. Today’s show is a journey into the heart of trade, innovation, and global connections.

item.title: RT special: Global Lens - Insights from the CIIE 2023 Opening Day | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description The world once again looks to Shanghai as the 2023 China International Import Expo kicks off in a spectacular fashion. #RoundTableChina shares remarkable highlights of this year’s Expo on its opening day. What sets it apart from the precious iterations? How does it symbolize China’s commitment to high-level openness and international collaboration? Join us and take a closer look at this global economic extravaganza. Transcript

item.title: Why young audiences enjoy breakup movies | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description In a world where love can be as unpredictable as the weather, we’ve all been through the ups and downs of relationships. While a happy ending is what most would appreciate for a good love story, more and more young audiences start to develop a special taste for breakup movies. Why is that? / Heart to Heart - please send your audio questions to ezfmroundtable@foxmail.com (19:24)! On the show: Niu Honglin, Xingyu & Josh Cotterill

item.title: How to make a city walkable? | Round Table China

Our discussion today focuses on the significance of walkable cities in solving these urban issues. On the show: Niu Honglin, Xingyu & Josh Cotterill Transcript

item.title: Employment background checks: Where are the boundaries? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description In an era where even your digital footprint might impact your career, the question of where employment background checks should begin and end is more relevant than ever. Today, on Round Table, we embark on a journey through the complexities of this practice. / Emotional intelligence test attracts young adults in China (17:57). On the show: Niu Honglin, Fei Fei & Yushun Transcript

item.title: Following others vs. treading your own path, what's for you? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description In life’s pivotal moments, we often grapple with the age-old question: should we follow the well-worn paths tested out by tradition and others’ experiences, or shall we dare to blaze our unique trail into the unknown? The choices we make at these moments can significantly impact our lives and our futures. Today, Round Table takes you to discover the pros and cons of both approaches. On the show: Niu Honglin, Fei Fei & Yushun

item.title: Why are grownups playing hide-and-seek? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description Hide-and-seek is one classic childhood game, for kids under the age of 10, I would think. But in Chinese cities nowadays, Gen-Z adults are also playing hide-and-seek and are proud of doing so. Hear this one out: Playing Hide and Seek with Strangers may seem a bit childish for kids around ten, but is just right for adults in their twenties. What gives? / Chinese musicians turn everyday objects into music magic (22:08).

item.title: Online shopping vs. In-store: Who's winning the price game? | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description E-commerce is a huge part of our economy. But here’s the question: Is online shopping still the wallet-friendly choice, or are brick-and-mortar stores winning the price war? On the show: Heyang, Yushun & Josh Cotterill Transcript

How powerful is it to be a consumer’s first choice? / Pain-free mountain hike (20:00). On the show: Heyang, Li Yi & Brandon Yates Transcript

item.title: Digital solutions for smarter cities | Round Table China
item.description: Podcast Description As cities get smarter, the plan is for them to become more livable and responsive. In China, various levels of government have been pushing for smart cities. We are now just seeing a preview of the marvels of technology in the urban environment. But as we all know, new tech brings its own set of problems. We discuss the pluses and pitfalls of smarter cities! Can we make smart cities wiser too?

item.title: What has Beijing Marathon witnessed since its inception in 1981? | Round Table China
